paper_abstract: Let G be a graph with n vertices and mu(1), mu(2), ..., mu(n) denote the Laplacian eigenvalues of G. The Laplacian Estrada index of G is defined as LEE(G) = e(mu 1)+...+e(mu n). show that if G has c connected componenets and maximum degree Delta, then LEE(G) >= c + e(Delta+1) + (n - c - 1)e((2m-Delta-1)/(n-c-1)) with equality if and only if G is either a star or the union of c copies of a complete graph on Delta + 1 vertices. This improves a known lower bound.
paper_title: A Lower Bound for Laplacian Estrada Index of a Graph
